name: getKeysAtPathFromNestedObject

type.rawType: <T extends { [key: string]: any; }>(nestedObject: T, objectPath: string) => any

value:
<T extends { [key: string]: any }>( //NestedObject<null>
  nestedObject: T,
  objectPath: string
) => {
  const pathParts = objectPath.split("/");
  const objectAtLocation = pathParts.reduce((objectSubset, part) => {
    // basecase should never happen
    if (!objectSubset) return;
    const subset = objectSubset[part];
    return subset;
  }, nestedObject as T);

  const children = objectAtLocation ? Object.keys(objectAtLocation) : [];

  return children;
}
description:
Gets all children keys of a nested object at a certain (nested) location in the nested object

`nestedObject` should extend the NestedObject.

The reduce is a bit vague, I need to  test this function further to make sure it does exactly what I want.
